009
010package imagingbook.common.color.cie;
011
012import imagingbook.common.math.Arithmetic;
013
014/**
015 * <p>
016 * Defines static methods for converting between CIE-XYZ coordinates (3D)
017 * and xy chromaticity values (2D). See Sec. 14.1.2 of [1] for details.
018 * </p>
019 * <p>
020 * [1] W. Burger, M.J. Burge, <em>Digital Image Processing &ndash; 
021 * An Algorithmic Introduction</em>, 3rd ed, Springer (2022).
022 * </p>
023 * 
024 * @author WB
025 */
026public abstract class CieUtils {
027        
028        private CieUtils() {}
029        
030        /**
031         * Calculates the XYZ coordinates for a given point (x,y) in the CIE
032         * xy-color diagram. XYZ is located on the 3D plane X + Y + Z = 1.
033         * Returns (0,0,0) for y = 0;
034         * @param x x-coordinate (in the 2D xy-diagram)
035         * @param y y-coordinate (in the 2D xy-diagram)
036         * @return the associated XYZ coordinate
037         */
038        public static double[] xyToXYZ(double x, double y) {
039                return xyYToXYZ(x, y, 1.0);
040        }
041        
042        /**
043         * Float version of {@link #xyToXYZ(double, double)}.
044         * @param x x-coordinate (in the 2D xy-diagram)
045         * @param y y-coordinate (in the 2D xy-diagram)
046         * @return the associated XYZ coordinate
047         */
048        public static float[] xyToXYZ(float x, float y) {
049                return xyYToXYZ(x, y, 1.0f);
050        }
051        
052        /**
053         * Calculates the XYZ coordinates for a given point (x,y) in the CIE
054         * xy-color diagram, with Y explicitly specified.
055         * @param x x-coordinate (in the 2D xy-diagram)
056         * @param y y-coordinate (in the 2D xy-diagram)
057         * @param Y the Y-coordinate (in 3D color space)
058         * @return the associated XYZ coordinate
059         */
060        public static double[] xyYToXYZ(double x, double y, double Y) {
061                if (Arithmetic.isZero(y)) {
062                        return new double[] {0, 0, 0};
063                }
064                else {
065                        double X = x * Y / y;
066                        double Z = (1 - x - y) * Y / y;
067                        return new double[] {X, Y, Z};
068                }
069        }
070        
071        /**
072         * Float version of {@link #xyYToXYZ(double, double, double)}.
073         * @param x x-coordinate (in the 2D xy-diagram)
074         * @param y y-coordinate (in the 2D xy-diagram)
075         * @param Y the Y-coordinate (in 3D color space)
076         * @return the associated XYZ coordinate
077         */
078        public static float[] xyYToXYZ(float x, float y, float Y) {
079                if (Arithmetic.isZero(y)) {
080                        return new float[] {0, 0, 0};
081                }
082                else {
083                        float X = x * Y / y;
084                        float Z = (1 - x - y) * Y / y;
085                        return new float[] {X, Y, Z};
086                }
087        }
088        
089        /**
090         * Calculates the 2D (x,y) color diagram coordinates for 3D XYZ color 
091         * coordinates (X,Y,Z).
092         * 
093         * @param XYZ the XYZ coordinate (3D)
094         * @return the xy-coordinate (2D)
095         */
096        public static double[] XYZToxy(double[] XYZ) {
097                double X = XYZ[0];
098                double Y = XYZ[1];
099                double Z = XYZ[2];
100                double mag = X + Y + Z; 
101                return (Arithmetic.isZero(mag)) ? 
102                                new double[] {0, 0} : new double[] {X/mag, Y/mag};
103        }
104        
105        /**
106         * Float version of {@link #XYZToxy(double[])}.
107         * 
108         * @param XYZ the XYZ coordinate (3D)
109         * @return the xy-coordinate (2D)
110         */
111        public static float[] XYZToxy(float[] XYZ) {
112                double X = XYZ[0];
113                double Y = XYZ[1];
114                double Z = XYZ[2];
115                double mag = X + Y + Z; 
116                return (Arithmetic.isZero(mag)) ? 
117                                new float[] {0, 0} : new float[] {(float) (X/mag), (float) (Y/mag)};
118        }
119        
120}
